title: Orthopaedic Sports Medicine
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course is designed to give students a comprehensive and in-depth understanding of sports injuries – their causes, mechanisms, assessments and treatments with specific emphasis on recent advances in diagnosis and management skills.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the causes and mechanisms of common sports injuries; and consolidate essential injury prevention knowledge and skills.
syllabus: Common risk factors associated with and that may influence sports injuries will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Sports Injury Prevention and Rehabilitation
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to develop a comprehensive and interdisciplinary approach to prevention, treatment and management of sports injuries. Clinical knowledge, practical skills for evidence-based practice in sports medicine are provided. Through a combination of formal classroom and clinical experience, injury prevention strategies and rehabilitation management are introduced in this course.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the factors and mechanisms that affect participation and tactics for preventing sports injuries.
syllabus: The principles and goals of rehabilitation and return-to-play, and the rehabilitative exercise, corrective exercise, functional appraisal, clinical clearance and return-to-play protocol in a rehabilitation plan will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Applied Sports Science for Performance Enhancement
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of physiological, psychological and biomechanical theories and practical techniques applied to enhance sports performance. Exercise physiology, sports nutrition, sports psychology and some popular issues such as sports participation in extreme environments are covered.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify and apply the physiological, psychological and biomechanical theories for enhancing sports performance.
syllabus: Factors determining sporting performance, methods to assess athletes’ abilities and ways to improve sports performance will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Medical Problems Encountered During Exercise and Sports Participation
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to demonstrate significant depth of knowledge of the medical aspects of sports medicine. It focuses on the identification and treatment of medical conditions of cardiovascular system, respiratory system, endocrine system, urinary and neurological system associated with physically active individuals and athletes.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the medical problems that occur during exercises; and deal with medical situations appropriately.
syllabus: The basic principles and concepts of disease pathophysiology will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: The Multidisciplinary Approach in Sports Medicine
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to give students a comprehensive understanding of the applications of sports medicine from different disciplines in athletes, recreational sportsmen and the general population. It will focus on the multidisciplinary approach that allows sportsmen to recover from injuries and various health conditions.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to optimize overall health and wellness in athletes, recreational sportsmen and the general population; and evaluate and respond to injuries and various health conditions.
syllabus: The importance of multidisciplinary approach in sports medicine will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Emergency Sports Medicine
requirements: For students in PgDip or MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to provide comprehensive knowledge and practical skills in the assessment, treatment and management of emergent sports injuries. Emergent sports medicine management skills, emergency procedures, and advanced assessment skills, care and management of the specific injuries including head, spine, thoracic, and musculo-skeletal injuries are covered.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify, evaluate and handle any injuries or conditions that may occur during sports events.
syllabus: Assessment, treatment and management of emergent and urgent sports injuries will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Sports Medicine Seminars & Clinical Trainings
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course aims to widen the exposure of students and enable them to apply knowledge and skills they have learnt. It offers opportunities for students to attend various academic symposia throughout their study period and to have clinical attachment in the sports injury clinic.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to learn the latest development of sports medicine industry.
syllabus: Updated information of sports medicine industry will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Team Doctor / Physiotherapist (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course is designed for doctors and physiotherapists. It aims to provide students with comprehensive team physician training. Students are able to learn and practice through workshops and on-field training in local and overseas mega sports events and sports competitions.The module runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one, and attend on-field training in semester two.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the role of team physician and team physiotherapist; and consolidates the assessment, treatment and rehabilitation skills of sports injuries.
syllabus: Students will learn and practice the role of team physician and on-field medical management at pitch side.
required_readings: FIMS Team Physician Manual

title: Team Doctor / Physiotherapist (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Details please refer to ORTY5041 Team Dr / Physio (I).
outcome: Details please refer to ORTY5041 Team Dr / Physio (I).
syllabus: Students will learn the on-field medical management at pitch side through workshops and on-field training in mega sports events and local/overseas sports competitions.
required_readings: FIMS Team Physician Manual

title: Strength and Conditioning Coach (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course is co-organized by CUHK and Hong Kong Sports Institute. Students are able to practise the most advanced and scientific training for elite athletes for the best strength and conditioning. Students are able to make use of the knowledge gained to design a training plan and coach an athlete at the end of semester.This elective runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one (SCC I), and conduct a training programme in semester two (SCC II).
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to identify the role of strength and conditioning coach; and consolidates the assessment and training techniques.
syllabus: Scientific knowledge and skills train the strength and conditioning of an athlete for better performance will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Strength and Conditioning Coach (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Details please refer to ORTY5051 Strength and Conditioning Coach (I).
outcome: Details please refer to ORTY5051 Strength and Conditioning Coach (I).
syllabus: Details please refer to ORTY5051 Strength and Conditioning Coach (I).
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Students are required to conduct an independent research project / a systematic review or a meta-analysis on a specific topic related to sports medicine and health science. The module instructor and the project supervisors will guide the students to utilize the literature search engine to conduct a scientific systematical search, to quantitatively evaluate the quality of the paper to determine inclusion. If it is a research project, students will further formulate the research question, and then design the method and conduct sample size estimation. After collecting the data, students are required to perform statistical analysis, interpret the summarized data, and discuss the findings and values of the paper. Students have to present the topic and methodology in a research seminar in the first semester, and present the data and interpretation in the second semester.
outcome: By the end of this course, students should be able to learn how to conduct a scientific research / systematic review or meta-analysis; and write up a publishable paper.
syllabus: In-depth understanding of a topic related to sports medicine and health science should be demonstrated.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: Details please refer to ORTY5061 Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I).
outcome: Details please refer to ORTY5061 Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I).
syllabus: Details please refer to ORTY5061 Research Project and Systematic Review or Meta-Analysis (I).
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Athletic Training (I)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Sciences
description: This course focuses on injury prevention, evaluation and acute care of sports injuries. Students will take up the role in bridging coaches, players and health care professionals in sports teams and will assist coaches in training. Students are able to learn through lectures, workshops and on-field training in various sports events.The elective runs across two semesters. Students will have in-house training in semester one (AT I), and attend on-field training in semester two (AT II).
outcome: By the end of this course, students will be able to identify the role of Athletic Trainer; and consolidate the assessment, treatment and rehabilitation skills.
syllabus: The prevention, acute care, and re-conditioning of sports injuries will be covered.
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Athletic Training (II)
requirements: For students in MSc Sports Medicine and Health Science
description: Details please refer to ORTY5081 Athletic Training (I).
outcome: Details please refer to ORTY5081 Athletic Training (I).
syllabus: Details please refer to ORTY5081 Athletic Training (I).
required_readings: Refer to the references provided by individual speakers.

title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in MPhil Orthopaedics and Traumatology
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignment for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis
outcome: After finishing this course, to help students become more independent, confident and efficient learners
syllabus: Students should be able to know the basic principles and concept
required_readings: Refer to the reference provided by supervisor

title: Seminar
requirements: For students in MPhil Orthopaedics and Traumatology
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work performed in the previous term/year.
outcome: After finishing this course, to help student understand, synthesize, analyze the major study themes
syllabus: Students should be able to know the basic principles and concept
required_readings: Refer to the reference provided by supervisor
